item.title: Nintendo Year In Review Finally Released For 2025
item.content:encoded:
Two weeks into 2026, and Nintendo has finally released its Year In Review for Switch and Switch 2 players.

To access your Nintendo 2025 Year In Review, simply go to the recap’s landing page and sign in with your Nintendo Account. From there, you’ll see stats such as the number of games you played, and the amount of time spent on the system.

In addition, you’ll find out the games you played the most, the types of games you favored, and a month-by-month breakdown of how much you played.

“Your Nintendo Switch 2025 Year in Review has arrived,” Nintendo said on social media. “Check out not only your 2025 adventures, but memories from past years with your Nintendo Switch as well.”

Nintendo joins other platforms like Steam and PlayStation with their “wrapped” or year in review features. The only one of the major platforms that didn’t release one for 2025 was Xbox. Microsoft skipped this year, reportedly, due to budget constraints.

As far as why Nintendo waited so long to release this time around, that hasn’t been mentioned. Past versions came in the weeks leading up to Christmas, making 2025’s the latest one yet.

What did your Nintendo Year In Review reveal about your playtime on the Switch and/or Switch 2? Leave your recap details down in the comments, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the new gameplay trailer for Carmageddon: Rogue Shift. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Why Isn’t Hytale Email Verification Working? Hytale Email Not Sending Issue, Explained
item.content:encoded:
If you’re here because you haven’t gotten a verification email for Hytale, you’re not alone in this regard. This is a widespread problem preventing many users from buying the sandbox title.

It’s one problem after another, isn’t it? If it’s not servers, it’s something else. In this case, it’s a pesky verification email not sending as intended. Many aspiring Hytalers have found themselves unable to even buy the game and start it up, so let’s go through what we know so far.

Why Am I Not Getting Hytale Verification Email?

The accepted reason for Hytale email verification not working as intended is due to the Hytale servers being overloaded, causing a huge backlog of emails and applications.

If you check the official Hytale Discord Server, Reddit, or search for “Hytale email” on X, you will find you’re most definitely not the only one suffering from this issue.

Quite simply, Hytale is proving to be EXTREMELY popular. Hytale was expecting one million players for the early access launch, and one would suspect that it’s comfortably surpassed this. A wall is being hit, though, as thousands of potential buyers aren’t getting the email verification notice.

It was recommended that all interested parties buy the game and install the Hytale Launcher before the official early access release day on January 13. If you have left it until its debut, you are likely one of thousands, maybe hundreds of thousands of players, all trying to verify purchases and access the game simultaneously, which is presumably more than the current server capacity can handle.

To be clear, the Hytale servers are working on launch day, and the email verification is a separate issue.

When Will I Get My Hytale Email Verification?

The fact is, you will receive the email verification notice for Hytale, but it will take time to come through. If it does, and it’s past the time limit cutoff, try again.

The system will catch up, and the developer is likely working on increasing capacity or manually addressing the problem. The team hasn’t officially acknowledged the issue (as of writing), but rest assured that the issue won’t fall on deaf ears. Keep checking for emails, request a new one if you have to, and be patient as it all works itself out.

Conversely, if you’ve found a workaround that guarantees you get the email verification and proceed, let other players and those in the community know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server, so the message can be shared far and wide.

Read about the Best Hytale Mods you need to download, how to play with Friends in Hytale, and how to enable PvP for more guides.

item.title: Activision Releases New Black Ops 7 Patch With Weapons Update
item.content:encoded:
Activision has released another new patch for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. This update features a number of adjustments to Black Ops 7’s multiplayer, end game, and weapons throughout.

Weapons getting updates include the Maddox RFB, M15 MOD 0, AK-27, Sturmwolf 45, XR-3 Ion and more. Elswehere, the update features changes to four maps, one perk, one equipment, and other areas.

Check out the details of the update below, and leave your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord server.

Black Ops 7 January 13 Patch

General

  • Base Sprint to Sprint Fire Time (used with Gung Ho perk) now matches base Sprint to Fire Time for all weapons.

Assault Rifles

Maddox RFB

General Adjustments

  • Recoil increased
  • All movement speeds reduced by 0.05 m/s

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 28
    • Range: 0–12.7m (was 0–19.1m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 19
    • Range: 12.8–27.9m (was 19.2–33m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 16
    • Range: >27.9m (was >33m ↓)

Maddox RFB – 13″ MFS Echo-Fire Barrel

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 23
    • Range: 0–20.3m (was 0–22.9m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 19
    • Range: 20.3–34.3m (was 30–36.8m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 16
    • Range: >34.3m

Additional Adjustments

  • Recoil increased

M15 MOD 0

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 21
    • Range: 0–30.5m (was 0–38.1m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 18
    • Range: 30.5–46.4m (was 38.2–46.4m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 17
    • Range: >46.4m

Additional Adjustments

  • Slide-to-Fire increased: 420ms → 430ms
  • Hip Spread increased by 0.1°
  • All movement speeds reduced by 0.05 m/s

16″ Reticulated Barrel

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.55x → 1.6x

AK-27 (Battle-Scar Conversion)

Conversion Adjustments

  • Fire Rate penalty reduced: 100% → 70%
  • Movement penalties removed
  • ADS penalty reduced: 60ms → 30ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire penalty reduced: 60ms → 30ms
  • Fixed Comb attachment persistence issue

X9 Maverick

14.6″ MFS Pulse Load+ Barrel

  • Damage Range penalty reduced: 25% → 13%
  • ADS improvement increased: 20ms → 30ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire improvement increased: 15ms → 25ms
  • Movement Speed bonus increased by 0.03 m/s

DS20 Mirage

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 27
    • Range: 0–22.9m (was 0–20.3m ↑)
  • Medium Damage: 23
    • Range: 23–44.5m
  • Minimum Damage: 22
    • Range: >44.5m

Mirage Tandem Launcher Adjustments

  • Burst delay improved: 350ms → 300ms
  • Swap time improved: 550ms → 420ms

Submachine Guns (SMGs)

Sturmwolf 45

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 30 (was 29 ↑)
  • Other damage ranges unchanged

Additional Adjustments

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.2x → 1.26x

15″ Regnant Barrel

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.25x → 1.35x
  • Vertical recoil penalty reduced: 45% → 30%
  • Horizontal recoil penalty reduced: 20% → 15%

Sturmwolf 45 – MFS Tigris .40 Cal Mag

Damage Adjustments

  • Medium Damage Range 2: 23 (was 22 ↑)

Additional Adjustments

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.2x → 1.26x
  • Vertical recoil penalty reduced: 80% → 65%
  • Horizontal recoil penalty reduced: 40% → 30%
  • Recoil deviation penalty reduced: 50% → 35%

Kogot-7

Damage Adjustments

  • Minimum damage reduced: 14 → 13

Ryden 45K

General Adjustments

  • Reduced gun kick and view kick harshness

Razor 9mm

12″ MFS Sidewinder Barrel

  • Horizontal & vertical recoil improvement increased: 10% → 25%
  • Recoil stabilization increased: 15% → 25%
  • ADS penalty increased: 15ms → 20ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire penalty increased: 15ms → 20ms

Dravec 45

Damage Adjustments

  • All damage ranges reduced across the board

Additional Adjustments

  • ADS time increased: 230ms → 235ms

Carbon 57

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 23 (was 22 ↑)
  • Medium Damage 1: 19 (was 18 ↑)
  • Medium Damage 2: 16 (was 15 ↑)
  • Minimum Damage: 14 (was 13 ↑)

Handling Adjustments

  • ADS: 240ms → 245ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire: 170ms → 180ms
  • Tactical Sprint-to-Fire: 290ms → 300ms
  • Slide-to-Fire: 360ms → 380ms
  • Dive-to-Fire: 440ms → 460ms
  • Fixed iron sight ADS alignment

MPC-25

General Adjustments

  • Reduced random gun kick and view kick deviation

Kühn Ported Comp

  • Sprint Fire Hip Spread bonus reduced: 25% → 15%

8.6″ MFS Stratus-X Barrel

  • Range increased across all damage tiers

VAS Tactical Scale Stock

  • Sprint Fire Hip Spread bonus reduced: 15% → 10%

LMGs

Sokol 545

General Adjustments

  • Reduced recoil on default fire mode
  • Reduced View Kick strength and deviation on fast fire mode

Marksman Rifles

M8A1

MFS Striker Tactical Stock

  • Tac Stance spread bonus increased: 63% → 66%
  • Flinch penalty reduced: 40% → 18%

2mw Adaptive Tactical Laser

  • Tac Stance aim walking speed increased: 0.4 → 0.9 m/s

Sniper Rifles

XR-3 Ion

General Adjustments

  • Improved shot queuing window to prevent accidental follow-up bursts

Pistols

Velox 5.7

4″ MFS Celeste Barrel

  • Hip Spread improved by 15%
  • Jumping/Landing stability increased: 40% → 60%
  • Fixed Swap Speed bonus not applying

CODA 9

General Adjustments

  • Adaptive Discharge Mod and MFS DeltaCell Bulk Mag can no longer be equipped together

Launchers

A.R.C. M1

General Adjustments

  • Shots no longer queue during overheat cooldown

Special Weapons

NX Ravager

General Adjustments

  • Fixed projectile velocity and arc inconsistencies

Melee Weapons

Ballistic Knife

General Adjustments

  • Weapon no longer auto-stows when out of ammo
  • Remains equipped after last blade is fired

Multiplayer

Maps  

  • Fringe
    • Added collision to areas where players could get out of the map.
  • Yakei
    • Added collision to an area where players could get out of the map. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Meltdown
    • Added collision to an area where players could get out of the map. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Flagship
    • Flagship has been temporarily removed from the map pool due to a stability issue. (Added Jan. 9)

Perks  

  • Bankroll
    • Closed an exploit where Bankroll could grant all Perks when using the Specialist Wildcard. (Added Jan. 9)

Equipment  

  • Stim Shot
    • Addressed an issue preventing XP Progression on the Stim Shot Overclock. Stim Shot will now also gain progress when healing at least 10HP.

Audio 

  • Reduced the frequency of Announcer voice lines in The Ghouls.

Stability 

  • Addressed stability issues when using the Rhino Scorestreak. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Added various stability fixes.

Zombies

UI 

  • Addressed an issue where the After Action Report could show an Armory unlock for the NX Ravager after the player had already unlocked it.

Stability

  • Added various stability fixes.

Endgame

Gameplay

  • Addressed an issue where party members could be pulled out of the Endgame cinematic early and lose their loadout after defeating Faulkner when in a party.
  • Addressed an issue where calling in a Rhino or Power Armor while holding a melee weapon would cause the player to lose their Exotic weapon and melee weapon rarity.
  • Addressed an issue where Supply Crates could be opened more than once.

For more Insider Gaming, read about more footage from Monolith’s canceled Batman game appearing online. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…
